entry.title: Game: Professor Layton and the Last Specter (DS, 2011) (6)
entry.content: I've got to the final battle. Every game ends in kind of the same way, but kind of totally different. It's wild.

entry.title: Game: Professor Layton and the Last Specter (DS, 2011) (5)
entry.content: During the last week I've been playing more than one puzzle a day because I want to empty my queue. Tonight I played for a little more two hours while watching YouTube videos. I did one of the marble jump puzzles on my first try, it was awesome.

entry.title: Movie: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows, starring Robert Downey, Jr. (2011)
entry.content: This was an interesting movie. The whole plot is really loose and a bit lifeless compared to the first. It improves a lot towards the end. The beginning just feels like lots of stupid moments for Downey to do his thing. It's funny of in this universe Holmes is this weird kung-fu master guy. There's lots of really cool effects and moments that I enjoyed in the movie though.

entry.title: Movie: The Muppets, starring Jason Segel (2011)
entry.content: This was a hilarious movie with lots of really subtle and clever moments. It's really amazing and hard to express all the crazy, funny things in it.

entry.title: Movie: Jane Eyre, starring Mia Wasikowska (2011)
entry.content: I'd never read Jane Eyre before, but didn't have very big expectations for this movie. It was very well done and pretty fascinating. I found the story to go very slowly and have a really unpredictable structure. I expected to learn more about the boarding school, but did not. I expected to learn more about her job after meeting the Rivers, but did not. It seemed like it was going to be a horror story before the old wife is revealed. After getting through my expectations, it was very enjoyable.
